_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The owner, management and employees of The Cairo Co-operative Equity Exchange are didicated to the prevention of an accidnetal release of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire company, or other authorities, to mitigate any releases and minimize the impact of the release to the people and the environment. The primary activity at the facility is the storage and blending of fertilzers for sale to farmer.  Anhydrous ammoina is recieved, stored and transfered for use as a crop production nutrient.

The maximum quantity handled would be the 262,140# stored in our storage tanks.  We also have the potential for 65,535# in rolling stock.  This gives us a total of 327,675#.

Ther worst case release scenario and the alternate case scenario have been removed at the request of the EPA.  All important information will be forwarded to the local first responders.  

The facility has implemented the provisions of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61/1" and the standards of OSHA, 29 CFR 1910.111.  In addition, the Department of Agriculture inspects our plants on an annual basis.  We also meet the current underwriting guidelines of our Insurance and undergo annual loss control surveys based on both physical property and safety/operational procedures.  NOTE:  The Kansas Department of Agriculture has not yet adopted the most recent ANSI standard.  Our company realizes the importance of keeping current with the standards and will do our best to budget any needed time and money to bring facilities up to the current code.

Our firm has an outstanding safety record at this location.  In the past five years we have had no reportable accidents nor to our knowledge have we had any off-site deaths, injuries, sheltering in place, evacuations or environmental damage.  

Our firm has a detailed emergency action plan that, in the event of a major release, requires employees to notify ot

her employees, call 911, and evacuate the area.  Our company does not allow employees to respond to hazardous NH3 releases.    

Safety improvements are an ongoing process at our firm.  We are dedicated to safely serving our customers and protecting the employees that work for us.  As part of this training our facilities are inspected on a regular basis for maintenance and safety needs.  

There are no known repairs or improvements needed at this time.

Training, equipment, and maintenance are of the highest quality and design.  We are proud of our efforts and proud to serve the communities in which we operate.
